title: Is a 17 inch laptop really that bad for college? - Quora

response.answer_text: I travel a lot and have a 13″ 2018 Macbook Pro. I use it daily for business use. Its a lovely fast laptop. The programs used are Excel, Word, Google Calendar, Gmail and Maps. I am mostly doing job costing and require most of the above programs open at the same time. As the 13″ laptop screen is too small to accommodate all of the above, I try to get around this by swiping across screens or squeezing two or three of the programs onto one screen. Neither option is ideal as I either am swiping back and forth which slows me down (especially if you get distracted and you forget the number you had just memorized) or I am squinting/readjusting apps in one screen. Another thing I have tried is bringing my Chromebook with me. I would have 2 laptops open and use the MacBook for the MS office work and the Chromebook for the internet work. It works well but it looks silly in public places. I have, as a result decided that I need a bigger screen. I have never had a 17″ laptop and just bought the new (Q4) 2-in-1 2018 Dell Inspiron. I am hoping this laptop makes a difference and that I can lose the Chromebook or at least be way faster and more productive. If anyone is interested in hearing how it goes, I can report back later.

I have owned quite a few 17″ “laptops”, and I put quotes around that term, they are portable workstations. They are very heavy. Forget to try to use them in airplanes, coffee houses or anywhere where people are crammed together, someone will bump into you. And I had Powerbooks and Macbooks pro when they were 17″, loved them. I hated it when I had to go 15″, learnt to like it and eventually love the form factor. I saw a 17″ Macbook pro just a few months ago, WHAT A MONSTER. I would not buy such a machine today, no way no how. I would suggest against it. You need space on your desk and 17″ is just crazy big.
